reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Improving livelihoods of agropastoral and pastoral community in Somaliland

description.narrative: The areas of Sheikh and Burao in Somaliland have suffered from draughts, which has weakened the production of the main livelihoods of the area, plants and cattle. Both areas produce animal feed for sale but both the production and marketing are carried out in an unplanned manner, and the production models are not sustainable. The purpose of the project is to develop the production of fodder and sisal as a livelihood in the whole value chain from acquiring production inputs to the selling the products to cus tomers. As the focal sphere of operations of the project has been chosen the augmentation of the volume and profitability of fodder productivity, the increase in the sisal production and strengthening the profitability of the sisal products especially with women groups as well as the improvement of the water supply and the state of the environment. The expected results of the project are: Increased access and availability of fodder in the target villages, enhanced sisal production (yield and bi-product) by women farmers and the capacity of the local partner organization and the project staff to manage livelihoods project is strengthened. The project has about 1020 direct beneficiaries of which 55 % are women. The project is implemented by ISF?s long-term loc al partner organization Candlelight fot Health, Environment and Education (CLHE).
